question_text: Which of the following best describes a 64-bit CPU?
answer_options: It is limited to accessing 4GB of RAM
It supports a larger address space than a 32-bit CPU
It uses only one processing core
correct_answer: It supports a larger address space than a 32-bit CPU
explanation: A 64-bit CPU can address more memory than a 32-bit CPU, allowing it to support modern operating systems and applications that require more than 4GB of RAM.
